metadata.title: CVE-2019-9499 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The implementations of EAP-PWD in wpa_supplicant EAP Peer, when builtagainst a crypto library missing explicit validation on imported elements,do not validate the scalar and element values in EAP-pwd-Commit. Anattacker may complete authentication, session key and control of the dataconnection with a client. Both hostapd with SAE support and wpa_supplicantwith SAE support prior to and including version 2.4 are affected. Bothhostapd with EAP-pwd support and wpa_supplicant with EAP-pwd support priorto and including version 2.7 are affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9499` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 2:2.6-15ubuntu2.2
wpagui - 2:2.6-15ubuntu2.2
wpasupplicant - 2:2.6-15ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.6-15ubuntu2.2').
